definition: joy/to joke/to banter/to tease/to mock/Taiwan pr. [nu:e4]

sentences.english: Shanghai men are quipped as hen-pecked husbands;
sentences.chinese: 上海男人常被戲謔爲“妻管嚴”。

sentences.english: Shanghai men are jokingly called hen-pecked husbands.
sentences.chinese: 上海男人常被戲謔爲“妻管嚴”。

sentences.english: To let you smoke a cigarette, drink a cup of wine, a time.
sentences.chinese: 去讓你吸上一支菸，喝上一杯酒，戲謔光陰。

sentences.english: A joke never gains over an enemy, but often loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 戲謔不能化敵爲友，倒常使人失去朋友。

sentences.english: A party is in progress, and Hoffmann mockingly praises the pleasures of the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 霍夫曼處身於宴會中，以戲謔的口吻感嘆肉體的歡愉。

sentences.english: A joke never gains an enemy but loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 戲謔不能化敵爲友，支能使人失去朋友。

sentences.english: He gives me a slightly wicked grin.
sentences.chinese: 他給我一個有幾分戲謔的咧嘴一笑。

sentences.english: Joke never gains an enemy but often loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 戲謔總不能化敵爲友，反而有時會失去朋友。

sentences.english: I kid a lot about feeling bad and getting angry but depression is no joke.
sentences.chinese: 我會戲謔壞情緒和憤怒，但抑鬱卻開不得玩笑。

sentences.english: Although Shanghai men are bantered as henpecked husbands, they do not submit to their wives.
sentences.chinese: 雖然上海男人被戲謔爲妻管嚴，但他並不屈從於妻子。

sentences.english: A joke never gains an enemy but loses a friend .
sentences.chinese: 戲謔不能在化敵爲友只能使人失去朋友。

definition: to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
